com.heat.engine.graphics.image

Class TextureCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.heat.engine.graphics.image.TextureCollection

  • public class TextureCollection
extends java.lang.Object
    The TextureCollection is a class that can hold textures.
    This is used to group textures and have them on a location that can easily
    be shared among other classes as a static object.
    This class itself is not static and has to be initiated.
    Since:
    2015-12-02
    Author:
    Pontus Wirsching

    • Method Detail

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String key,
                Texture texture)
        Puts a Texture into the textures HashMap.
        Parameters:
        key - (String) - Key that will identify the texture.
        texture - (Texture)

      • loadTexture

        public void loadTexture(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String path)
        Loads a texture directly into the HashMap.
        This avoids the need of first loading a texture
        and then putting it into the TextureCollection.
        Parameters:
        key - (String) - Key that will identify the texture.
        path - (String) - Relative path to the image file.

      • get

        public Texture get(java.lang.String key)
        Parameters:
        key - (String) - Key to identify the requested texture.
        Returns:
        (Texture)
        The texture connected to the key inserted in the first parameter.

      • getImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage(java.lang.String key)
        Retrieves the BufferedImage object inside the texture.
        This method might be removed if proved unnecessary.
        Parameters:
        key - (String) - Key to identify the texture.
        Returns:
        (BufferedImage)
        The BufferedImage contained inside the Texture class.
